data.name: ping.description
data.value: Current shard count is {0} and your shard number is {1} and latency is {2}ms.

data.name: autovoice.description
data.value: **Setup Auto Voice on your Discord server.** Over here you can either choose to **setup auto voice channels** or adjust its properties per channel you have already setup. For example you can choose to adjust the **user limit** in your channel or change a **channel themes** for different channel names.

data.name: autovoice.theme.channel.description
data.value:
Please select an existing **auto voice channel** that you already have setup and want to have different names for once they are created.
This channel and setting can still be modified later with a specific theme and user join limit by re-running `/autovoice` command in the future.

data.name: autovoice.theme.select.description
data.value: Please choose your desired channel theme you want to use for newly created channels when join to create has been triggered.

data.name: autovoice.theme.updated.description
data.value: The channel theme has been successfully set to {0}. New channels will be created with the theme of **{1}**.

data.name: autovoice.theme.set.description
data.value: Please choose your desired channel theme you want to use for newly created channels when join to create has been triggered.

data.name: autovoice.disable.description
data.value:
This will remove the auto voice channel from the database and no longer create channels once joined.
You can always add this channel again through the `/autovoice` command in the future.

data.name: autovoice.disable.channel.success
data.value:
{0} has been disabled and successfully removed from the database. This channel will no longer create channels when users join.
You can always setup the channel again in the future with the `/autovoice` command."

data.name: autovoice.setup.channel.description
data.value:
Auto Voice has been successfully setup for channel {0}. You can now join the channel and the bot will create channels with the default theme.
If you wish to change the channel theme or user limit run `/autovoice` again and choose the other options and pick the {0} channel when asked.

data.name: autovoice.setup.channel.complete
data.value:
Select **voice channel** that members should join in-order to create a new temporary channel within your Discord server.
This channel can be modified later with a specific theme and user join limit after initial setup.

data.name: autovoice.users.description
data.value:
Please select an existing **auto voice channel** that you already have setup and want to limit the amount of users that can join upon creation.
This channel and setting can still be modified later with a specific theme and user join limit by re-running `/autovoice` command in the future.

data.name: autovoice.users.select.description
data.value: Choose the desired channel that you want to enforce a user limit to newly created channels.

data.name: autovoice.users.select.limit.set.description
data.value: The channel user limit has been successfully set for {0}. New channels will be created with the limit of **{1}** users.

data.name: autovoice.channel.notfound
data.value: The channel does not exists within the database, you can try again by doing the `/autovoice` slash command again and choose a different channel.

data.name: autovoice.error.permission
data.value: Permission error! **{0}** has no permission for **{1}** in {2}. Please make sure the bot has corresponding permissions set before trying again.

data.name: autovoice.error.channel.exists
data.value: Auto voice channel {0} already exists, please re-run the `/autovoice` command and select a different channel or disable the existing one to reset the channel setup.

data.name: error.duplicate.setting.description
data.value: The same setting has already been set please try again...

data.name: exception.error
data.value:
Something went wrong please report the following error if necessary:
```{0}``` **Discord Server:** [{1}]({2})

data.name: parse.error
data.value: The channel you are trying to use could not be parsed. Please try again.
